system.name: CivicLens
system.description: CivicLens is a comprehensive citizen complaint management system designed for efficient civic grievance handling. It enables citizens to report issues via web, mobile app, or WhatsApp, with AI-powered classification, geo-based routing, and real-time tracking.

features.name: Multi-Channel Complaint Submission
features.description: Citizens can submit complaints through web app, mobile app, WhatsApp bot, or voice messages

features.name: AI-Powered Classification
features.description: Complaints are automatically categorized using GROQ AI into categories like Roads, Water, Garbage, Electricity, Sanitation, and Others

features.name: Geo-Based Routing
features.description: Complaints are automatically routed to the correct Union Council (UC) based on GPS location

features.name: Real-Time Tracking
features.description: Citizens can track complaint status from submission to resolution with SMS/WhatsApp notifications

features.name: Voice Complaints
features.description: Submit complaints via voice messages in English, Hindi, or Urdu - automatically transcribed

features.name: Image Evidence
features.description: Attach up to 5 photos as evidence of civic issues

features.name: SLA Monitoring
features.description: Service Level Agreement tracking with automatic escalation on breach

features.name: Analytics Dashboard
features.description: Real-time dashboards for UC Chairmen, Town Chairmen, and Mayors to monitor complaints

faq.question: How do I report a complaint?
faq.answer: You can report via WhatsApp by messaging +92 318 3610230, through our website, or mobile app. Simply describe your issue, share location, and optionally add photos.

faq.question: How long does it take to resolve a complaint?
faq.answer: Resolution time depends on the category: Garbage (24 hours), Water/Sanitation (48 hours), Roads (72 hours), Others (96 hours). Complex issues may take longer.

faq.question: Can I track my complaint?
faq.answer: Yes! Use your Complaint ID to track status. On WhatsApp, send 'status' to see your recent complaints. You'll also receive SMS/WhatsApp notifications on status changes.

faq.question: What if my complaint is rejected?
faq.answer: Complaints may be rejected if they're duplicates, outside jurisdiction, or lack required information. You can submit a new complaint with more details.

faq.question: Is this service free?
faq.answer: Yes, CivicLens is completely free for citizens. It's a public service initiative to improve civic governance.

faq.question: What areas does CivicLens cover?
faq.answer: Currently, CivicLens operates in Karachi, covering all 7 districts and their Union Councils. We're expanding to other cities soon.

faq.question: Can I submit a complaint anonymously?
faq.answer: Your phone number is required for tracking, but your personal information is kept confidential and not shared publicly.

faq.question: Who handles my complaint?
faq.answer: Complaints are routed to the UC Chairman of your area, who assigns them to relevant department officers.
